column4: anyone around who knows the equivalent command for "Safely Remove"?
it doesnt power down the device...
need to get rid of the icon in the menus too
lol just unplug it, then the icon will go poof :P
I still actually need the device. It's Huawei 3G stick, and the drive I want to remove is the emulated CD that has the windows drivers.
and all this should happend automatically
stuff like that doesn't work on linux :/
what doesnt? There is the "Safely Remove" command in the right click menu that does shut down the device for good.
but I want the command line equivalent
Well I dont exactly know what it is, but it is mounted as CD, but it definitely ain't one.
right. well, i still have something mounted that i want to power down.
